column1: #Text=We synthesized polycrystalline samples with compositions CuGa1-xFexTe2 where x = 0.0, 0.01, 0.02, 0.03, 0.04, and 0.05 by melt and anneal method.
#Text=High purity specimens, Cu (99.99%), Fe (99.99%) Ga (99.9999%), Te (99.9999%) were used in synthesis.
#Text=After weighing in stoichiometric amounts and dry mixing, starting materials were sealed in evacuated quartz tube.
#Text=These tubes were then heated gradually to 1173 K, and were held at this temperature for 12 h followed by annealing at 873 K for same period of time.
#Text=After annealing, samples were slowly cooled down to ambient temperature.
#Text=Obtained ingots were then crushed into fine powders with mortars.
#Text=Pellets of obtained powders were prepared by Spark plasma sintering at 823 K under 50 MPa in an inert atmosphere.
#Text=These high dense pellets were used for further characterizations.
